intro: Erigeron elatior, commonly known as the tall blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as fields and roadsides, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its blue to purple flower heads consist of both ray and disk florets, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
